options.A: patient who underwent radiation therapy for breast cancer 28 months ago presents with numbness in the 3rd and 4th fingers and arm pain. What is the next best step in management?

question_text: In a patient with Acute Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (AIDP), what is the characteristic clinical finding?

options.A: Progressive, symmetrical muscle weakness with absent deep tendon reflexes
options.B: Asymmetrical muscle weakness with preserved reflexes

question_text: Scenario of progressive bulbar palsy: what is the diagnosis?

options.A: Progressive bulbar palsy

question_text: In the context of periodic paralysis, which of the following statements is true regarding serum potassium levels?

options.A: Always low in hypokalemic periodic paralysis
options.B: Always high in hyperkalemic periodic paralysis
options.C: Normal but may be high in hypokalemic periodic paralysis

question_text: What percentage of Guillain-Barré syndrome patients experience recurrence?

options.A: patient presents with clear symptoms of periodic paralysis lasting for hours. What is the next test that should be performed?

question_text: In patients with generalized Myasthenia Gravis, positive AChR-binding antibodies are found in what percentage of cases?
What is the effect of cold in hypokalemic periodic paralysis?

options.A: May induce an attack
patient presents with upper extremity painful neuropathy and atrophy. What is the recommended treatment?
35-year-old obese female has delayed muscle relaxation, complains of tingling in her hands, and has slight bradycardia in her vital signs. What investigation should be done?
patient presents with hand stiffness that worsens and becomes weak with exercise and cold. What is the diagnosis?

question_text: Which of the following conditions is characterized by paralysis that typically occurs in the first to second decade of life and predominantly affects males?

options.A: Hypokalemic Periodic Paralysis

question_text: In congenital myasthenia gravis, which channel types are involved?

options.A: Slow channel

question_text: In an elderly patient presenting with neuropathy and weakness, which of the following is a recommended diagnostic procedure if amyloidosis is suspected?

options.A: Fat aspiration

55-year-old male has a history of lower limb weakness for days, initially starting with numbness and tingling. Days later, the weakness involved the upper limbs and was associated with hyperhidrosis in the lower limbs and facial involvement. He also has a history of epigastric pain. Examination shows bilateral lower limb weakness. He received an influenza vaccine 2 weeks prior to the onset of symptoms. What is the diagnosis?
case of Bell's palsy underwent EMG. Which muscle is likely to show findings?

patient presented with falling down and an acetabulum fracture. After admission, he still has a very painful right leg; however, he noticed that he could not dorsiflex his right foot along with decreased sensation of the dorsum of the right foot. What is most likely injured in this patient?

question_text: What is the most sensitive test to diagnose myasthenia gravis (MG)?

options.A: Single fiber EMG

patient presented with right arm weakness that was slowly progressive for 5 years and then became static, involving multiple muscles while sparing the brachioradialis. The patient denies pain or trauma. What is expected to be found?

question_text: In a scenario of Acute Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (AIDP) on day 5, what will the nerve conduction study (NCS) show?

options.A: Sural sparing with affected median and ulnar nerves
options.B: Normal sensory and motor nerve conduction velocities
options.C: Reduced compound muscle action potential (CMAP) amplitudes without demyelination
options.D: Increased distal motor latencies with conduction block

question_text: Anti-MuSK Myasthenia gravis is characterized by which of the following features?

options.A: Tongue fasciculation and atrophy
patient with ALS presents with fatigue. What is the next best step in management?
patient with back pain radiating to the left lower limb and normal ankle reflexes is evaluated. Which muscle is involved?
